intro: Machaeranthera glabriuscula, commonly known as the plains coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy, yellow to orange blooms. The plant typically grows in open prairies and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually erect and branching. Machaeranthera glabriuscula is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
